title: Execution of the HACCP Plan on the Plant Floor
description: Requirements for HACCP plan implementation including worker training, CCP operator competency, monitoring compliance, record-keeping, corrective action execution, and verification of plan effectiveness

requirements.question: Is there documented evidence that all plant workers have attended a HACCP training, including specific training for CCP operators?
Do CCP operators understand basic HACCP principles and their role in monitoring CCPs?
Are the CCP monitoring activities and frequencies in conformance with the HACCP Plan and CCP SOPs?
Are CCP monitoring records signed off (or initialed) by the operator(s) who are carrying out and recording the CCP check?
Are the CCP records reviewed and signed off by the food safety supervisor and/or management (second signatory)?
Is there a deviation record detailing documented corrective actions when a deviation/loss of control of a CCP occurs (a critical control limit is exceeded)?

capaInject: Implement retraining procedures for CCP operators who fail to demonstrate understanding of their monitoring responsibilities or HACCP principles
Establish corrective actions when CCP monitoring activities deviate from documented frequencies or procedures requiring immediate compliance restoration
Develop action plans when CCP records are incomplete, unsigned, or contain data inconsistencies requiring enhanced oversight and training
Create preventive measures when supervisory review signatures are missing from CCP records including documented review procedures and accountability
Implement verification procedures to ensure corrective actions for CCP deviations address root causes and prevent recurrence
traceabilityInject: Maintain HACCP training records for all plant workers including CCP-specific training for operators with topics, dates, and competency verification
Keep CCP monitoring logs with complete data entries signed by operators performing checks showing compliance with monitoring frequencies
Retain supervisory review records with second signatory verification of CCP monitoring data and timely identification of deviations
Document deviation records for all CCP critical limit exceedances including corrective actions taken, product disposition decisions, and approval signatures
Archive competency assessment records demonstrating CCP operators understand HACCP principles and can correctly execute monitoring procedures
micro_inject: Inadequately trained CCP operators fail to recognize critical limit deviations allowing Salmonella survival in cooking processes
Poor understanding of HACCP principles results in CCP operators not responding appropriately when Listeria control measures fail
Monitoring compliance failures miss temperature deviations that permit pathogenic Bacillus cereus spore germination and toxin production
Incomplete or falsified CCP records mask control failures allowing products contaminated with E. coli O157:H7 to reach consumers
Lack of supervisory oversight allows repeated CCP deviations creating persistent conditions favorable for pathogen survival and cross-contamination
